_header: But false men make their fingers felt
Note:
French original in London, British Library Harley 2253; cf. Holthausen (1903)
XHolthausen, Ferdinand. “Zum Havelok.” Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und Literaturen 110 (1903): 100-2, 102.
Subjects: women, praise of; women, as speakers/narrators
_description: Praise of women (?by Lynne) — in 11-line stanzas , ababababcdc, with the first ‘c’ a short ‘bob’ line

NLS1921.First Lines:
…Bot fals men make her fingres feld& doþ hem wepe
                    wel sore to rewe…
NLS1921.Last Lines:
…Þe child þat our leuedi bareGrant hem heuen to
                    mede
NLS1921.Note: 330 lines in this MS; begins and ends imperfectly.
